00047 static char NO_DOCS[] = "NO DOCUMENTATION SPECIFIED";
00048 
00049 struct bArgDoc;
00050 typedef struct bArgDoc {
00051     struct bArgDoc *next, *prev;
00052     const char *short_arg;
00053     const char *long_arg;
00054     const char *documentation;
00055     int  done;
00056 } bArgDoc;
00057 
00058 typedef struct bAKey {
00059     const char *arg;
00060     uintptr_t pass; /* cast easier */
00061     int case_str; /* case specific or not */
00062 } bAKey;
00063 
00064 typedef struct bArgument {
00065     bAKey *key;
00066     BA_ArgCallback func;
00067     void *data;
00068     bArgDoc *doc;
00069 } bArgument;
00070 
00071 struct bArgs {
00072     ListBase docs;
00073     GHash  *items;
00074     int     argc;
00075     const char  **argv;
00076     int   *passes;
00077 };
00078 
00079 static unsigned int case_strhash(const void *ptr)
00080 {
00081     const char *s= ptr;
00082     unsigned int i= 0;
00083     unsigned char c;
00084 
00085     while ( (c= tolower(*s++)) )
00086         i= i*37 + c;
00087 
00088     return i;
00089 }
00090 
00091 static unsigned int keyhash(const void *ptr)
00092 {
00093     const bAKey *k = ptr;
00094     return case_strhash(k->arg); // ^ BLI_ghashutil_inthash((void*)k->pass);
00095 }
00096 
00097 static int keycmp(const void *a, const void *b)
00098 {
00099     const bAKey *ka = a;
00100     const bAKey *kb = b;
00101     if (ka->pass == kb->pass || ka->pass == -1 || kb->pass == -1) { /* -1 is wildcard for pass */
00102         if (ka->case_str == 1 || kb->case_str == 1)
00103             return BLI_strcasecmp(ka->arg, kb->arg);
00104         else
00105             return strcmp(ka->arg, kb->arg);
00106     }
00107     else {
00108         return BLI_ghashutil_intcmp((const void*)ka->pass, (const void*)kb->pass);
00109     }
00110 }
00111 
00112 static bArgument *lookUp(struct bArgs *ba, const char *arg, int pass, int case_str)
00113 {
00114     bAKey key;
00115 
00116     key.case_str = case_str;
00117     key.pass = pass;
00118     key.arg = arg;
00119 
00120     return BLI_ghash_lookup(ba->items, &key);
00121 }
00122 
00123 bArgs *BLI_argsInit(int argc, const char **argv)
00124 {
00125     bArgs *ba = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bArgs), "bArgs");
00126     ba->passes = MEM_callocN(sizeof(int) * argc, "bArgs passes");
00127     ba->items = BLI_ghash_new(keyhash, keycmp, "bArgs passes gh");
00128     ba->docs.first = ba->docs.last = NULL;
00129     ba->argc = argc;
00130     ba->argv = argv;
00131 
00132     return ba;
00133 }
00134 
00135 static void freeItem(void *val)
00136 {
00137     MEM_freeN(val);
00138 }
00139 
00140 void BLI_argsFree(struct bArgs *ba)
00141 {
00142     BLI_ghash_free(ba->items, freeItem, freeItem);
00143     MEM_freeN(ba->passes);
00144     BLI_freelistN(&ba->docs);
00145     MEM_freeN(ba);
00146 }

00148 void BLI_argsPrint(struct bArgs *ba)
00149 {
00150     int i;
00151     for (i = 0; i < ba->argc; i++) {
00152         printf("argv[%d] = %s\n", i, ba->argv[i]);
00153     }
00154 }

00156 const char **BLI_argsArgv(struct bArgs *ba)
00157 {
00158     return ba->argv;
00159 }

00161 static bArgDoc *internalDocs(struct bArgs *ba, const char *short_arg, const char *long_arg, const char *doc)
00162 {
00163     bArgDoc *d;
00164 
00165     d = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bArgDoc), "bArgDoc");
00166 
00167     if (doc == NULL)
00168         doc = NO_DOCS;
00169 
00170     d->short_arg = short_arg;
00171     d->long_arg = long_arg;
00172     d->documentation = doc;
00173 
00174     BLI_addtail(&ba->docs, d);
00175 
00176     return d;
00177 }
00178 
00179 static void internalAdd(struct bArgs *ba, const char *arg, int pass, int case_str, BA_ArgCallback cb, void *data, bArgDoc *d)
00180 {
00181     bArgument *a;
00182     bAKey *key;
00183 
00184     a = lookUp(ba, arg, pass, case_str);
00185 
00186     if (a) {
00187         printf("WARNING: conflicting argument\n");
00188         printf("\ttrying to add '%s' on pass %i, %scase sensitive\n", arg, pass, case_str == 1? "not ": "");
00189         printf("\tconflict with '%s' on pass %i, %scase sensitive\n\n", a->key->arg, (int)a->key->pass, a->key->case_str == 1? "not ": "");
00190     }
00191 
00192     a = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bArgument), "bArgument");
00193     key = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bAKey), "bAKey");
00194 
00195     key->arg = arg;
00196     key->pass = pass;
00197     key->case_str = case_str;
00198 
00199     a->key = key;
00200     a->func = cb;
00201     a->data = data;
00202     a->doc = d;
00203 
00204     BLI_ghash_insert(ba->items, key, a);
00205 }
00206 
00207 void BLI_argsAddCase(struct bArgs *ba, int pass, const char *short_arg, int short_case, const char *long_arg, int long_case, const char *doc, BA_ArgCallback cb, void *data)
00208 {
00209     bArgDoc *d = internalDocs(ba, short_arg, long_arg, doc);
00210 
00211     if (short_arg)
00212         internalAdd(ba, short_arg, pass, short_case, cb, data, d);
00213 
00214     if (long_arg)
00215         internalAdd(ba, long_arg, pass, long_case, cb, data, d);
00216 
00217 
00218 }
00219 
00220 void BLI_argsAdd(struct bArgs *ba, int pass, const char *short_arg, const char *long_arg, const char *doc, BA_ArgCallback cb, void *data)
00221 {
00222     BLI_argsAddCase(ba, pass, short_arg, 0, long_arg, 0, doc, cb, data);
00223 }
00224 
00225 static void internalDocPrint(bArgDoc *d)
00226 {
00227     if (d->short_arg && d->long_arg)
00228         printf("%s or %s", d->short_arg, d->long_arg);
00229     else if (d->short_arg)
00230         printf("%s", d->short_arg);
00231     else if (d->long_arg)
00232         printf("%s", d->long_arg);
00233 
00234     printf(" %s\n\n", d->documentation);
00235 }
00236 
00237 void BLI_argsPrintArgDoc(struct bArgs *ba, const char *arg)
00238 {
00239     bArgument *a = lookUp(ba, arg, -1, -1);
00240 
00241     if (a) {
00242         bArgDoc *d = a->doc;
00243 
00244         internalDocPrint(d);
00245 
00246         d->done = 1;
00247     }
00248 }
00249 
00250 void BLI_argsPrintOtherDoc(struct bArgs *ba)
00251 {
00252     bArgDoc *d;
00253 
00254     for (d = ba->docs.first; d; d = d->next) {
00255         if (d->done == 0) {
00256             internalDocPrint(d);
00257         }
00258     }
00259 }
00260 
00261 void BLI_argsParse(struct bArgs *ba, int pass, BA_ArgCallback default_cb, void *default_data)
00262 {
00263     int i = 0;
00264 
00265     for ( i = 1; i < ba->argc; i++) { /* skip argv[0] */
00266         if (ba->passes[i] == 0) {
00267              /* -1 signal what side of the comparison it is */
00268             bArgument *a = lookUp(ba, ba->argv[i], pass, -1);
00269             BA_ArgCallback func = NULL;
00270             void *data = NULL;
00271 
00272             if (a) {
00273                 func = a->func;
00274                 data = a->data;
00275             }
00276             else {
00277                 func = default_cb;
00278                 data = default_data;
00279             }
00280 
00281             if (func) {
00282                 int retval = func(ba->argc - i, ba->argv + i, data);
00283 
00284                 if (retval >= 0) {
00285                     int j;
00286 
00287                     /* use extra arguments */
00288                     for (j = 0; j <= retval; j++) {
00289                         ba->passes[i + j] = pass;
00290                     }
00291                     i += retval;
00292                 }
00293                 else if (retval == -1) {
00294                     if (a) {
00295                         if (a->key->pass != -1)
00296                             ba->passes[i] = pass;
00297                     }
00298                     break;
00299                 }
00300             }
00301         }
00302     }
00303 }
